alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 4:31PM MDT until June 06 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... South central Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 431 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sapello, or 12 miles north of Las Vegas, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Montezuma, La Cueva, Tierra Monte, Storrie Lake State Park, Sapello, South Carmen, Manuelitas and Golondrinas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 near Mile Marker 362. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 3 and 5. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 11. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 1. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 4 and 25. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
